data.text: as far as I know, free camping in Greece is forbidden by law. Authorities are more strict from March till October, due to fire problem. If you are away from crowded beaches, archaeological sites and private properties, you'll have no problem. By the sea, the rule is to set your tent before dark, and pack (not leave) before sunrise. Locals can be very helpful too.

data.text: No problem if you're not too arrogant. In Germany, Poland, there are many camping sites in resort places. In any case, it is possible to find a forest away from home from 1 hour before dark. There are no problems at all on the seaside. Do not light bonfires using primus, gas burner. Any fire is banned in Greece.
